reviews.text: Best eel I have ever had. Extremely friendly service. Family run. Impossible not to smile enjoying this beautiful culinary experience. So yourself a favor and give this place a try!
ìµœê³  ğŸ‘
Excellent around around.  3 of us had grilled eel dinners.   Friendly hosts.  No wait.   Talked with host about eel weirs.   Will go again for sure.

You drive past their gardens and the river on the way in where most of your food is coming from. Everything made to order, they ask you to call the day before and place your order. Service was outstanding, and included explanations of everything and best ways to eat it. A legit Korean spot in the middle of the woods.
Everything was so tasty, especially the makgeolli! If youâ€™re planning to go with a larger group, Iâ€™d recommend calling ahead to reserve a table.

great pit stop during our trip out to the Catskills! delicious grilled eel and chicken dish. also, make sure to quench your thirst with their makgeolli, a traditional unfiltered Korea rice wine!

ìš°ì™€.......ì—¬ê¸° ì €ë§Œì•Œê³ ì‹¶ì–´ìš”ã…¡ã…œã…œ
ë‰´ìš•ì—ì„œ ì œì¼ìµœê³ . .

Owners seems like nice people but food was not worth the long trip. Tough and chewy chicken, and skinny and burnt eels. $70 for 2 skinny-ass eels..and most parts are burnt.. wouldn't go back..
If you want to visit, make sure to call 20 mins prior to arrival to re-confirm your reservation and make sure there's table available and the menu you ordered ahead will be ready.. I made reservation for 4 ppl and even told her what I'll be ordering and asked her to have the food ready/almost ready. She said ok. When we arrived, she said food will take a while... at least we had a table.. there were others who had reservation didn't even have table and had to wait until we were finished...
Wonderful farm to table meal! A must visit location!

If you like grilled eel or want to try it, then you MUST go.

You wonâ€™t find a better spot ANYWHERE. Great portion. Lovely flavors.

Call/text ahead to give them a heads up. The owners are super friendly and full of love!

Makgeolli/rice wine is also the best. I refuse to drink from other brands.

Canâ€™t wait to go back!

NYMakgeolli Brewery & Pub is a must-visit! The makgeolli is expertly crafted and the food is super fresh and delicious, perfectly complementing the makegeolli. The staffâ€™s knowledge and passion enhance the experience, making it both fun and informative. Donâ€™t miss out on the food and grab a few bottles to enjoy later. Highly recommend!
This is a gem the makgeolli was amazing and the food was unbelievable. They have authentic korean food and it was incredible. Itâ€™s a family run place and the owners were super friendly.
This place is amazing! The owners' hospitality is incredibleâ€”super friendly and generous. The food was excellent, and I felt at home here. â¤ï¸
Amazing authentic food, excellent made-at-home makgeolli. The owners were friendly, generous and provided a homey ambience for our group of 7.
The service and food was AMAZING! My friends and I had such a great time. The owners are so kind and generous- had such a fun time!! This is a must try!!!!
Such a wonderful, family owned place food was amazing came with a group and the owners were so nice !!! Thank you so much for an amazing lunch!
No frills authentic homemade food. The owners were so kind and generous. Our group had an amazing time, the eel is delicious, and service outstanding!

excellent  experience / service/ makgeolli . The owners are really nice , the fresh eel that we have tried and the different sidedishes are very interesting . Off the beaten track location ,  but every time we have a consistently good experience. No frills dining room , nice location
We came here on a Friday evening. We loved all the food & the owner was so nice. The eel with sauce was so good that I didn't get a picture.

This was such a hidden gem that our family discovered during a trip to the Catskills area. About 20 minutes away from Kartrite, and absolutely worth the drive if youâ€™re looking for authentic Korean food. Itâ€™s a small menu, but very special because the couple owns one of the only for eel fishing licenses in the state of NY.  Iâ€™ve had plenty of eel before prepared in sushi, but never had freshwater eel grilled like this!  I was so pleasantly surprised at how much I enjoyed it. Fresh, mild flavor, and the grilled texture was perfect with a little char.  My two young daughters also really liked it.  It was especially good eaten in a ssam wrap. All the kkaenip and banchan were vegetables from their garden, fresh and delicious. The other dish we ordered was the dakdoritang. When he brought it out, he had mentioned that the chicken meat may be a bit more tough than what we are used to because itâ€™s from the chickens they have in the back!  It was indeed different than the GMO chicken we see often thatâ€™s plump full of whole knows what, but it definitely was more tasty. Nice and spicy, good contrast with the potatoes and carrots, and the stew was delicious over rice. Again, my girls loved the dish and asked for more rice to have with the soup.

But wait, thereâ€™s more that makes this place so memorable! They make their own makgeolli and sell in bottles with no preservatives.  Itâ€™s soooo much better than what you find commercially in grocery stores. Itâ€™s less sweet, no artificial sugary taste at all, more tart, and higher alcohol content. Since we had to drive back, we needed to walk off the unexpected buzz and the sweet owners graciously let us explore their property. We saw the chickens, eels, and walked to the river where the eels are caught.  It was a beautiful area, especially on a warm fall day, and the whole experience was truly one to be remembered.

Highly recommend this place. Itâ€™s not big, so better for small groups. Worth traveling for though since you really canâ€™t find a place that cooks fresh eel like this anywhere in NYC.

This is a special place. In the middle of nowhere and all of a sudden there's not just a healthy, farm to table option, but one with very tasty food as well. Lots of love goes into their food. The menu is small but all you need. You know they do the few things on the menu, well.

I had the eel and all that came with it. 10/10.  I'll be back first chance to have more of that and try the rest.

The best eel gui ever in the states. Of course, you can easily find good eel places in Korea but I was never able to find one here. I finally found one, and tasted almost as same as my favorite place in Jeju. The chicken dish (we had the dakdoritang) was also very tasty as the meats were so tender and well absorbed by the seasoning. Furthermore, the chefâ€™s banchan was just incredible. Very humble and not very special selections but very satisfying .. not overly seasoned and not salty yet you could almost taste Koreaâ€™s countryside. I would definitely bring my family and friends again. Love it!!!!

The wife and I had the eel dish, and the chicken dish.
my wife is Keran she says it is fantastic and i agree.
the chicken dish was so good i wonted to drink the sauce .
we love NY Makgeolli brewery. you must try the Makgeolli .
jerry and Chuil  C.

I've been coming here for a long time when they were at different location long time ago. Back then, the owner gave lots of portion of chicken and rice but they really changed for the worse.

I went with about 8 group of people and we ordered 4 whole chickens. It was not 4 whole chickens. They only cook half of the portion and fill the plate with liquid. Extremely disappointed. As you can see on the picture, they give no chicken. I really hope the owner reads this and change the way they operate. Please don't go with a group of people because they will rip you off that petty. If you are going to go,just order 1 portion because whether you order 1 or 4 portions, they will use the same amount of ingredient.

Also, they give such small portion of rice. We had to literally ask them to give rice 5 times and they bring so little. If they are going to be that stingy giving free refills of rice at a korean restaurant , just charge the rice then for them to feel better.
She keeps telling us to use the liquid leftover from
the chicken and mix with rice, but makes no sense since they are too cheap to give rice anyway.
So no meat and no rice period at this place.

I won't be returning, they definitely are not what they used to be. I hope they give proper portions for the price they charge. Please reconsider coming with your significant others.
Great experience and very kind owners.

Recently stopped by here after going to Catskills and my wife loved the food there.

The restaurant is owned by this sweet couple that is very friendly.
Really authentic Korean food with perilla leave wraps and other side dishes. Vegetable and eel is farm or fresh to table. They have their own farm and lake nearby for the fresh food.

Wife is looking for opportunities to go back there again for the food even though we live 3 hours away.

Such a nice experience and delightful time we had with authentic Korean food.  The owners cooked and served us and couldn't have been sweeter or more attentive. And the food was fabulous! Try the wine they make, we loved it! Not what you would expect in this area of NY but worth the trip!

The food is good, but the portion is too small,and the side dishes are too small, In general,Korean food is plentiful, but it is not
feel hungry even after eating ,ë°˜ì°¬ì´ ë„ˆë¬´ ì—†ê³ , ì–‘ë„ ì ë‹¤
great

The homemade Makgeolli(Korean traditoional rice wine)is the best among the ones Iâ€™ve tasted. The foods were made with fresh ingredients. It was great. The location was also easy to find as it was by the road.

The best Korean food in upstate New York
Highly recommended and an incredible bargain

Wonderful husband and wife team! The food was so fresh, delicious, and perfectly prepared. Very limited menu that has been perfected. Farm to table, literally!
The veggies available are dependent on the season and harvested by the owners.
Will def come back!!
The husband stacks the rocks, very cool!!

What a charming discovery!! Run by a couple who clearly sees their gift of hospitality as an act of love, and the expression of their joy. I canâ€™t wait to return for their eel dish. Places like this are like rare gems to be sweetly cherished! I am so grateful they are deciding to share their delicious creations!

They are having soft opening now, so dont expect a big menu. But it's a must try when you pass by the area, very unique style, not like an usual restaurant everywhere, we are here to enjoy. Food ingredients are fresh from their farm, directly cook by order so try to call in first if you dont want to wait. Natural is beautiful n the owners are kind.

ì¹œì ˆí•˜ì‹œê³  ì›ƒì›€ì´ ê¹Šì€ ì‚¬ì¥ë‹˜ì— ê°ì‚¬í•©ë‹ˆë‹¤. ë§›ìˆëŠ” ìŒì‹ ê°€ì¡±ê³¼ í•¨ê»˜ ì¦ê±°ìš´ ì‹œê°„ì„ ë³´ë‚´ê³  ê°‘ë‹ˆë‹¤.

I had an incredible lunch! Ate at a very authentic Korean restaurant! We had grilled eel, one side was meaty the other was crispy. The texture was so different from a typical sushi restaurant. It's worth noting that their eel is only available in fall since they can only catch it at the end of summer.

Really enjoyed an amazing lunch this past weekend at NY Makgeolli.  The proprietors are a wonderful local couple that have been working hard to build their restaurant and finally have started with a soft opening.  The makgeolli won't be flowing until later this year and the menu is currently limited.  However, our meal was packed with flavor and impressive were the various kimchees/banchan they provided as a proper accompaniment to the meal.  Most, if not all, were made on site and came from their garden.
They have grilled, freshwater eel that was tasty but for me, the dakdoritang, a spicy braised chicken dish with potatoes was the star.  The succulent chicken in a spicy, savory and sweet sauce just perfectly balanced and although a copious portion, we succeeded in finishing as it was quite addictive.  I quickly got over the void of makgeolli as soju was a great accompaniment.  They offer beer and soft drinks also.
We walked around their property after the meal as it extends to the river and sat for a moment to soak in the nature.  A fun and memorable outing which we plan to do again soon.  Some tips are that the property is right off route 209, cash only at the moment and making a reservation may be helpful although not required.
